creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: brown slipware freehand scroll pattern over chocolate brown
portfolio: From Salvaged from the wreck of a Chinese junk (sank c. 1643)
text: While kraak porcelain found particular popularity in Europe, China was producing Swatow ware for export to Japan, Southeast Asia, India, and Indonesia.  Named for a port city from which they were exported, these dishes have a distinctively gritty glaze and were made along the southern coast of China in the 16th and 17th centuries.
title: Dish
